function.description: User can click to access the BMI calculator page from the home page.
User can enter their height in meters or inches.
User can enter their weight in kilograms or pounds.
User can choose between metric and imperial units for measurement.
User can click a button to calculate BMI based on the provided height and weight.
User can see their BMI value displayed after calculation.
User can see the BMI category they fall into (e.g., underweight, normal weight, overweight, obese).
User can clear existing inputs to start a new calculation.
User can read about what BMI is and how it is calculated.
User can learn about different BMI categories and their health implications.
Allows users to convert one currency to another using the simulated exchange rates.
Users can select the currency they want to convert from.
Users can select the currency they want to convert to.
Users can input the amount of currency they wish to convert.
Displays the simulated conversion rate between the chosen currencies.
Displays a list of current simulated exchange rates for different currency pairs.
Allows users to search for specific currencies to view their exchange rates.
Allows users to specify a date range to view historical simulated exchange rates.
Displays a graph showing trends in exchange rates over the selected time period.
Allows users to select a preferred language for the website interface.
Allows users to set a default currency for future conversions.
Click to access the password generator tool from the homepage.
View information about the website and its purpose.
Option to contact support for any issues or queries.
Allow user to specify the desired length of the password.
Choose types of characters like uppercase, lowercase, numbers, and symbols.
Create a password based on the selected criteria.
Copy the generated password to clipboard.
Configure default preferences like password length and character types.
Toggle dark mode for the website.
Browse frequently asked questions about the password generator.
Get in touch with customer support for additional help.
Allow users to input text or a URL to generate a QR code.
Enable users to upload an image file or use a webcam to scan a QR code.
Display a list of recently generated or scanned QR codes for the user.
Provide options to change the color, shape, and design of the QR code.
Provide information on the history and uses of QR codes.
Answer common questions users have about QR code generation and scanning.
Detail the features available with the free plan.
List the features and price of the professional plan.
Describe the features and pricing for large-scale business use.
Allow users to send inquiries or feedback through a contact form.
Provide users access to live chat support for technical assistance.
Allows users to upload a Markdown file for conversion.
Initiates the Markdown to HTML conversion process.
Enables users to download the converted HTML file.
Provides guidance on how to use the converter.
Displays the Markdown and corresponding HTML code side by side.
Offers a visual preview of the HTML output.
Allows users to make changes to the Markdown code directly.
Lets users select the desired CSS style for the HTML output.
Enables users to set preferences for specific conversion options.
Provides a form for users to submit feedback or report issues.
Directs users to contact support via email for assistance.
Display the list of all tasks to the user
Allow the user to create a new task and add it to the list
Enable the user to delete a task from the list
Allow the user to modify the details of an existing task
Enable the user to filter tasks based on criteria like date or status
Display detailed information about a specific task
Allow the user to change the status of a task (e.g., from 'pending' to 'completed')
Display analysis charts and statistics about tasks
Enable users to apply filters to the analytics data based on date range or categories
Displays the overall summary of budget and balance.
Allows users to add a new expense entry.
Enables users to modify details of an existing expense.
Allows users to remove an expense entry.
Permits users to record new income entries.
Allows users to update details of an existing income.
Enables users to delete an income entry.
Displays a chart showing the changes in balance over time.
Allows users to filter the balance chart by a specific date range.
Provides a detailed report of income and expenses for the month.
Enables users to export the report in various formats.
Allows users to define budget limits for different categories.
Enables the user to change the currency of the budget application.
Display the current month's calendar.
Switch between different months using previous/next buttons.
Quickly return to the current day and month.
Create a new event on a selected date.
Modify details of an existing event.
Remove an event from the calendar.
See details of events for a selected date.
Switch between light and dark modes.
Set reminders and notifications for events.
Select the display language for the application.
Initiate a conversation with the AI Chatbot.
Get detailed information about the AI Chatbot product.
Interact with the AI in multiple languages.
AI understands and remembers context from conversations.
AI offers personalized responses based on user preferences.
Explore different pricing plans available for the AI Chatbot.
Compare features across different pricing tiers.
Reach out to the support team for assistance.
Find answers to frequently asked questions about the AI Chatbot.
Allows users to create a new account to track their calorie intake.
Lets existing users log into their account.
Provides a summary of the app's features.
Displays the user's daily calorie intake summary.
Enables users to add food items and their calorie values.
Shows a history of the user's past entries.
Presents a visual chart of daily calorie intake.
Displays a breakdown of the nutrients consumed.
Highlights weekly trends in calories and nutrients.
Allows users to manage their personal details.
Lets users set preferences for notifications and reminders.
Provides options to adjust privacy features.
Show a welcome message or introduction to the password generator.
Button to the password generator page.
Provide information about the purpose and functionality of the website.
Allow users to log in to access either employee or admin functionalities.
Allow users to log out from the system.
Allows employees to submit new claims for travel, labor, management, and equipment expenses.
Allow employees to view the status of their submitted claims.
Allows administrators to approve pending claims submitted by employees.
Allows administrators to reject pending claims submitted by employees.
Allow administrators to view all claims submitted by employees with their current status.
Provides tools for administrators to analyze the balance of expenses against the budget.
Input and save new customer information including name, birthday, age, sex, company, and phone number.
Display a list of all customers with brief details.
Modify existing customer information.
Remove a customer from the system.
Select and save preferred products for a customer.
Input and save new product details including name, category, and recommended price.
Display a list of all products with their details.
Modify existing product information.
Remove a product from the system.
Record a new purchase with datetime, product, customer, quantity, and amount.
Display a list of all purchase records with details such as datetime, product, customer, quantity, and amount.
Modify details of an existing purchase record.
Remove a purchase record from the system.
Provide a summary of sales across all time periods with total sales amount and quantities.
Create comprehensive sales reports based on various parameters such as time period and product category.
Analyze and display which products are most popular based on sales data.
Analyze purchase trends of customers and identify patterns.
Displays the message 'Hello, World!' on the page.
Navigates the user to the 'helloword' page when the button is clicked
Load the 'Spring Semester Subjects.xlsx' file into the program.
Extract data from the Excel file into a structured format.
Convert the extracted data into a two-dimensional subject table.
Output the two-dimensional subject table into a new Excel file.
Show the two-dimensional subject table in an understandable format.
Arrange subjects by weekday and period for an organized view.
Load 'Gamedata.xlsx' into the program for further processing.
Create one-period-lag for the 'result' column in the dataset.
Identify and separate all columns except 'result' as independent variables.
Use the processed data to create a logistic regression model.
Output the summary of the logistic model to 'Logistic.xlsx'.
Initiate the game and display introductory text
Show instructions and commands available to the player
Move the character to the north
Move the character to the south
Move the character to the east
Move the character to the west
Examine the current location for details
Display the items currently held by the player
Add a nearby item to the inventory
Remove an item from the inventory
Use an item from the inventory
Interact with non-player characters (NPCs) in the game
Provide solutions to puzzles encountered in the game
Engage in combat with enemies
Attempt to flee from combat or danger
Check the player’s health, score, and other status metrics
Save the current game progress
Load a previously saved game state
Exit the game and return to the main menu
Allow users to upload the 'Deathlist.csv' file.
Show the content of the uploaded dataset for user's review.

Group the number of deaths by week.

Show the generated histogram to the user.
